quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth.
author: William W. Purkey

quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: A Testament of Hope: The Essential Writings and Speeches

quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Twilight of the Idols

quote: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde
title: Lady Windermere's Fan

quote: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: Coraline

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go...
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!

quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

quote: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou
title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one.
author: John Lennon

quote: It’s no use going back to yesterday, because I was a different person then.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain.
author: Maya Angelou
title: Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Horton Hears a Who!

quote: You can't live your life for other people. You've got to do what's right for you, even if it hurts some people you love.
author: Nicholas Sparks
title: The Notebook

quote: Well-behaved women seldom make history.
author: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
title: Well-Behaved Women Seldom Make History

quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby

quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Peace begins with a smile..
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present.
author: John Green
title: Looking for Alaska

quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival.
author: C.S. Lewis
title: The Four Loves

quote: I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby

quote: Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
author: George Orwell

quote: And once the storm is over, you won’t remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won’t even be sure, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm, you won’t be the same person who walked in. That’s what this storm’s all about.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Kafka on the Shore

quote: May you live every day of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Attitude is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Optimism is a choice. Kindness is a choice. Giving is a choice. Respect is a choice. Whatever choice you make makes you. Choose wisely.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: If my life is going to mean anything, I have to live it myself.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Lightning Thief

quote: First they ignore you. Then they ridicule you. And then they attack you and want to burn you. And then they build monuments to you.
author: Nicholas Klein

quote: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.
author: Robert Fulghum
title: All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten: Uncommon Thoughts On Common Things

quote: Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
author: A.A. Milne
title: Winnie-the-Pooh

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers  That perches in the soul  And sings the tune without the words  And never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: You can talk with someone for years, everyday, and still, it won't mean as much as what you can have when you sit in front of someone, not saying a word, yet you feel that person with your heart, you feel like you have known the person for forever.... connections are made with the heart, not the tongue.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
author: haruki murakami
title: What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quote: If you're reading this... Congratulations, you're alive. If that's not something to smile about, then I don't know what is.
author: Chad Sugg
title: Monsters Under Your Head

quote: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven..
author: John Milton
title: Paradise Lost

quote: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down ‘happy’. They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.
author: John Lennon

quote: Always do what you are afraid to do.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
author: William Shakespeare
title: The Tempest

quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: I Have a Dream: Writings and Speeches That Changed the World

quote: The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: Do not let your fire go out, spark by irreplaceable spark in the hopeless swamps of the not-quite, the not-yet, and the not-at-all. Do not let the hero in your soul perish in lonely frustration for the life you deserved and have never been able to reach. The world you desire can be won. It exists.. it is real.. it is possible.. it's yours.
author: Ayn Rand
title: Atlas Shrugged

quote: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: It is so hard to leave—until you leave. And then it is the easiest goddamned thing in the world.
author: John Green
title: Paper Towns

quote: Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it.
author: Lloyd Alexander

quote: Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
author: Isaac Asimov
title: Foundation

quote: Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worst kind of suffering.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

quote: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people’s hands.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: If you remember me, then I don't care if everyone else forgets.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Kafka on the Shore

quote: Accept yourself, love yourself, and keep moving forward. If you want to fly, you have to give up what weighs you down.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.  (Popular misquote of "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.")
author: Maya Angelou
title: Letter to My Daughter

quote: If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: I love to see a young girl go out and grab the world by the lapels. Life's a bitch. You've got to go out and kick ass.
author: maya angelou

quote: War is peace.  Freedom is slavery.  Ignorance is strength.
author: George Orwell

quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The Case-Book of Sherlock Holmes

quote: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Live the Life of Your Dreams: Be brave enough to live the life of your dreams according to your vision and purpose instead of the expectations and opinions of others.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Don’t waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: What I need is the dandelion in the spring. The bright yellow that means rebirth instead of destruction. The promise that life can go on, no matter how bad our losses. That it can be good again.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: Mockingjay

quote: It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.
author: Dale Carnegie
title: How to Win Friends and Influence People

quote: I don't trust people who don't love themselves and tell me, 'I love you.' ... There is an African saying which is: Be careful when a naked person offers you a shirt.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It’s only after you’ve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: And, in the end The love you take is equal to the love you make.
author: Paul McCartney
title: The Beatles Illustrated Lyrics

quote: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures. Simple in actions and thoughts, you return to the source of being. Patient with both friends and enemies, you accord with the way things are. Compassionate toward yourself, you reconcile all beings in the world.
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

quote: But I know, somehow, that only when it is dark enough can you see the stars.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The past is a place of reference, not a place of residence; the past is a place of learning, not a place of living.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: None but ourselves can free our minds.
author: Bob Marley

quote: The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
author: Rabindranath Tagore
title: Stray Birds

quote: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
author: A.A. Milne
title: Winnie-the-Pooh

quote: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.
author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

quote: Keep Going  Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever.
author: Lance Armstrong Sally Jenkins
title: Every Second Counts

quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.
author: Jim MORRISON

quote: You never fail until you stop trying.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someone’s life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I was smiling yesterday,I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow.Simply because life is too short to cry for anything.
author: Santosh Kalwar
title: Quote Me Everyday

quote: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.
author: St. Francis Of Assisi
title: The Little Flowers of St. Francis of Assisi

quote: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: He is half of my soul, as the poets say.
author: Madeline Miller
title: The Song of Achilles

quote: If you want to forget something or someone, never hate it, or never hate him/her. Everything and everyone that you hate is engraved upon your heart; if you want to let go of something, if you want to forget, you cannot hate.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come,  Whispering 'it will be happier'...
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: To see a World in a Grain of Sand  And a Heaven in a Wild Flower,  Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand  And Eternity in an hour.
author: William Blake
title: Auguries of Innocence

quote: Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.  If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close

quote: The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Believe in Your Heart  Believe in your heart that you're meant to live a life full of passion, purpose, magic and miracles.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page.
author: Cornelia Funke
title: Inkspell

quote: You're off to Great Places! Today is your day! Your mountain is waiting, So... get on your way!
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!

quote: If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you wont give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.
author: Bob Marley
title: Bob Marley: Guitar Chord Songbook

quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free.
author: Rumi

quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way.
author: Viktor E. Frankl
title: Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: One love, one heart, one destiny.
author: Robert Marley

quote: Top 15 Things Money Can’t Buy Time. Happiness. Inner Peace. Integrity. Love. Character. Manners. Health. Respect. Morals. Trust. Patience. Class. Common sense. Dignity.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.
author: J. K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quote: Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.
author: Clive Barker
title: Abarat: Days of Magic, Nights of War

quote: Acts of Kindness: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
author: Bukkyo Dendo Kyokai
title: The Teaching of Buddha

quote: If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?
author: Rumi

quote: So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and ¾ percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains.
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!

quote: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
author: Rumi

quote: It's not the face, but the expressions on it. It's not the voice, but what you say. It's not how you look in that body, but the thing you do with it. You are beautiful.
author: Stephenie Meyer
title: The Host

quote: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well...
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quote: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
author: Kathryn Stockett
title: The Help

quote: To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: ‎Though nobody can go back and make a new beginning... Anyone can start over and make a new ending.
author: Chico Xavier

quote: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Back to Methuselah

quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.
author: Christopher Paolini
title: Eldest

quote: Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared
author: Jon Krakauer
title: Into the Wild

quote: ‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
author: Voltaire

quote: A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.
author: John A. Shedd

quote: Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson
title: Speak

quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Better to be strong than pretty and useless.
author: Lilith Saintcrow
title: Strange Angels

quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.
author: Markus Zusak
title: I Am the Messenger

quote: Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
author: Bette Midler

quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
author: George Carlin

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
author: J. K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Lightning Thief

quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
author: Sarah Dessen
title: Keeping the Moon

quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Brida

quote: What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Lightning Thief

quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
title: The Shadow of the Wind

quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
author: Mitch Albom
title: The Five People You Meet in Heaven

quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: Try a little harder to be a little better.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
author: Lois McMaster Bujold
title: A Civil Campaign

quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.
author: Margaret Atwood
title: The Handmaid’s Tale

quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: George Eliot

quote: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!
author: Edward J. Stieglitz

quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
author: Anne Frank
title: The Diary of a Young Girl

quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Horton Hatches the Egg

quote: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Tears are words that need to be written.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
author: P.C. Cast
title: Betrayed

quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
author: Margaret Walker

quote: You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.
author: Randy Pausch
title: The Last Lecture

quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: It is not the size of the dog in the fight that counts, but the fight in the dog that wins.
author: Arthur G. Lewis
title: Stub Ends of Thought and Verse

quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
author: Anais Nin

quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir

quote: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.
author: Harvey Fierstein

quote: Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Atticus, he was real nice."  "Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them.
author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Essays of Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.
author: Peter S. Beagle
title: The Last Unicorn

quote: In the end these things matter most: How well did you love? How fully did you live? How deeply did you let go?
author: Jack Kornfield
title: Buddha's Little Instruction Book

quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin
title: The Life & Letters of Charles Darwin

quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
author: Louis L'Amour
title: Matagorda/The First Fast Draw: Two Novels in One Volume

quote: You are not rich until you have a rich heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
author: Fannie Flagg
title: Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe

quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: I’ve been fighting to be who I am all my life. What’s the point of being who I am, if I can’t have the person who was worth all the fighting for?
author: Stephanie Lennox
title: I Don't Remember You

quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
author: Moliere

quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: there is a place in the heart that will never be filled  a space  and even during the best moments and the greatest times times  we will know it  we will know it more than ever  there is a place in the heart that will never be filled and  we will wait and wait  in that space.
author: Charles bukowski

quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: All thinking men are atheists.
author: Ernest Hemingway
title: A Farewell to Arms

quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The Complete Prose Works Of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation." "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you.
author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Jane Eyre

quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
author: Gilles Deleuze
title: A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia

quote: We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. Thou shalt not is soon forgotten, but Once upon a time lasts forever.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
author: Doris Lessing
title: The Golden Notebook

quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
author: Pablo Picasso
title: Pablo Picasso: Metamorphoses of the Human Form : Graphic Works, 1895-1972

quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!
author: Mark A. Cooper
title: Operation Einstein

quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
author: John Green
title: Will Grayson, Will Grayson

quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Tolstoy Leo

quote: Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway, that's brave.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: Coraline

quote: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.
author: Napoleon Hill
title: Think and Grow Rich

quote: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.
author: Erin Morgenstern
title: The Night Circus

quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
author: Nora Roberts

quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!
author: John Anster
title: The First Part Of Goethe's Faust

quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: George Washington Burnap
title: The Sphere and Duties of Woman: A Course of Lectures

quote: I am a part of all that I have met.
author: Alfred Tennyson
title: The Complete Poetical Works of Tennyson

quote: I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.
author: John Green
title: An Abundance of Katherines

quote: There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills.
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra

quote: Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.
author: Patricia Cornwell

quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I - I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.
author: Robert Frost

quote: It’s your life; you don’t need someone’s permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life before Death. Strength before Weakness. Journey before Destination.
author: Brandon Sanderson
title: The Way of Kings

quote: Not being heard is no reason for silence.
author: Hugo, Victor
title: Les Misérables

quote: I am not a teacher, but an awakener.
author: Robert Frost

quote: . . . when it comes down to it, that’s what life is all about: showing up for the people you love, again and again, until you can’t show up anymore.
author: Rebecca Walker
title: Baby Love: Choosing Motherhood After a Lifetime of Ambivalence

quote: We don't make mistakes, just happy little accidents.
author: Bob Ross

quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Well, we all make mistakes, dear, so just put it behind you. We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us.
author: L.M. Montgomery
title: Anne of Avonlea

quote: Where there is ruin, there is hope for a treasure.
author: Rumi

quote: I’ve known people that the world has thrown everything at to discourage them...to break their spirit. And yet something about them retains a dignity. They face life and don’t ask quarters.
author: Horton Foote

quote: My only advice is to stay aware, listen carefully, and yell for help if you need it.
author: Judy Blume

quote: Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Men are from Earth, women are from Earth. Deal with it.
author: George Carlin

quote: We never know the quality of someone else's life, though we seldom resist the temptation to assume and pass judgement.
author: Tami Hoag
title: Dark Horse

quote: Happiness depends on your mindset and attitude.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Do Not Lie to Yourself   We have to be honest about what we want and take risks rather than lie to ourselves and make excuses to stay in our comfort zone.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ...
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Meditations

quote: If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
author: Confucius

quote: Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Hearts are breakable," Isabelle said. "And I think even when you heal, you're never what you were before".
author: Cassandra Clare
title: City of Fallen Angels

quote: Surround Yourself with People Who Believe in Your Dreams: Surround yourself with people who believe in your dreams, encourage your ideas, support your ambitions, and bring out the best in you.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Because paper has more patience than people.
author: Anne Frank

quote: No matter how your heart is grieving, if you keep on believing, the dreams that you wish will come true.
author: Walt Disney Company

quote: Sometimes life knocks you on your ass... get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Do what you love, love what you do, and with all your heart give yourself to it.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The real heroes anyway aren't the people doing things; the real heroes are the people NOTICING things, paying attention.
author: John Green
title: The Fault in Our Stars

quote: When you do the right thing, you get the feeling of peace and serenity associated with it. Do it again and again.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Just because you can doesn't mean you should.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quote: Once you realize you deserve a bright future, letting go of your dark past is the best choice you will ever make.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: There is a candle in your heart, ready to be kindled. There is a void in your soul, ready to be filled. You feel it, don't you?
author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

quote: Only after disaster can we be resurrected. It's only after you've lost everything that you're free to do anything. Nothing is static, everything is evolving, everything is falling apart.
author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: Fight Club

quote: There is no good and evil, there is only power and those too weak to seek it.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: You might as well answer the door, my child, the truth is furiously knocking.
author: Lucille Clifton
title: Good Woman: Poems and a Memoir 1969-1980

quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.
author: Helen Keller

quote: If you believe very strongly in something, stand up and fight for it.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The outer world is a reflection of the inner world. Other people’s perception of you is a reflection of them; your response to them is an awareness of you.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives - choice, not chance, determines your destiny.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: How would your life be different if…You stopped making negative judgmental assumptions about people you encounter? Let today be the day…You look for the good in everyone you meet and respect their journey.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.
author: Dale Carnegie
title: How to Win Friends and Influence People

quote: Spoon feeding in the long run teaches us nothing but the shape of the spoon.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.
author: Wayne W. Dyer

quote: We are flawed creatures, all of us. Some of us think that means we should fix our flaws. But get rid of my flaws and there would be no one left.
author: Sarah Vowell
title: Take the Cannoli

quote: Love: a single word, a wispy thing, a word no bigger or longer than an edge. That's what it is: an edge; a razor. It draws up through the center of your life, cutting everything in two. Before and after. The rest of the world falls away on either side.
author: Lauren Oliver
title: Delirium

quote: True love is not so much a matter of romance as it is a matter of anxious concern for the well-being of one's companion.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley
title: Stand a Little Taller: Counsel and Inspiration for Each Day of the Year

quote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Life is made of so many moments that mean nothing. Then one day, a single moment comes along to define every second that comes after. Such moments are tests of courage, of strength.
author: Sabaa Tahir
title: An Ember in the Ashes

quote: why are trying so hard to fit in, when you're born to stand out
author: Oliver James

quote: It's never too late to change your life for the better. You don't have to take huge steps to change your life. Making even the smallest changes to your daily routine can make a big difference to your life.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I must be willing to give up what I am in order to become what I will be.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
author: anaïs nin
title: The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 7: 1966-1974

quote: Shoot for the moon, even if you fail, you'll land among the stars
author: Cecelia Ahern
title: P.S. I Love You

quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

quote: The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings.
author: J.M. Barrie
title: The Little White Bird

quote: Everybody is special. Everybody. Everybody is a hero, a lover, a fool, a villain. Everybody. Everybody has their story to tell.
author: Alan Moore
title: V for Vendetta

quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts and made up of our thoughts. If a man speak or act with an evil thought, suffering follows him as the wheel follows the hoof of the beast that draws the wagon.... If a man speak or act with a good thought, happiness follows him like a shadow that never leaves him.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: It's okay,” he said. “We're together.” He didn't say you're okay, or we're alive. After all they'd been through over the last year, he knew that the most important thing was that they were together. She loved him for saying that.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Mark of Athena

quote: Always remember people who have helped you along the way, and don’t forget to lift someone up.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Meditations

quote: There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: You only need one man to love you. But him to love you free like a wildfire, crazy like the moon, always like tomorrow, sudden like an inhale and overcoming like the tides. Only one man and all of this.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The only person who can pull me down is myself, and I'm not going to let myself pull me down anymore.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Focus on your strengths, not your weaknesses. Focus on your character, not your reputation. Focus on your blessings, not your misfortunes.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: You'll never find a rainbow if you're looking down
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: To love and win is the best thing. To love and lose, the next best.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Life sucks, and then you die...
author: Stephenie Meyer
title: Breaking Dawn

quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of who you are
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
author: David Mitchell
title: Cloud Atlas

quote: The heart is the toughest part of the body.  Tenderness is in the hands.
author: Carolyn Forché
title: The Country Between Us

quote: I never want to change so much that people can't recognize me.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God

quote: If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Maturity is when you stop complaining and making excuses, and start making changes.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
author: Michel de Montaigne
title: The Complete Essays

quote: After all," Anne had said to Marilla once, "I believe the nicest and sweetest days are not those on which anything very splendid or wonderful or exciting happens but just those that bring simple little pleasures, following one another softly, like pearls slipping off a string.
author: L.M. Montgomery
title: Anne of Avonlea

quote: Be empty of worrying. Think of who created thought!  Why do you stay in prison When the door is so wide open?
author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
title: The essential Rumi

quote: The biggest wall you have to climb is the one you build in your mind: Never let your mind talk you out of your dreams, trick you into giving up. Never let your mind become the greatest obstacle to success. To get your mind on the right track, the rest will follow.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night, Old age should burn and rave at close of day; Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas
title: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night

quote: Above all else, guard your heart for it affects everything else you do.
author: Anonymous
title: Holy Bible: New International Version

quote: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: When in a relationship, a real man doesn't make his woman jealous of others, he makes others jealous of his woman.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Make the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Smile more. Smiling can make you and others happy.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: What's done is done. What's gone is gone. One of life's lessons is always moving on. It’s okay to look back to see how far you’ve come but keep moving forward.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Return of the King

quote: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.
author: Anaïs Nin
title: HENRY AND JUNE

quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside while still alive. Never surrender.
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Never stop dreaming,  never stop believing,  never give up,  never stop trying, and  never stop learning.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Meditations

quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Aim higher in case you fall short.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: Catching Fire

quote: We are products of our past, but we don't have to be prisoners of it.
author: Rick Warren
title: The Purpose Driven Life: What on Earth Am I Here for?

quote: Around here, however, we don't look backwards for very long. We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we're curious...and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
author: Walt Disney Company

quote: I may not always be with you  But when we're far apart Remember you will be with me Right inside my heart
author: Marc Wambolt
title: Poems from the Heart

quote: When the going gets tough, put one foot in front of the other and just keep going. Don’t give up.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: In the end you should always do the right thing even if it's hard.
author: Nicholas Sparks
title: The Last Song

quote: We meet no ordinary people in our lives.
author: C.S. Lewis; Inspirational Christian Library

quote: Strong people have a strong sense of self-worth and self-awareness; they don’t need the approval of others.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Those who do not weep, do not see.
author: Victor Hugo
title: Les Misérables

quote: Sometimes all a person wants is an empathetic ear; all he or she needs is to talk it out. Just offering a listening ear and an understanding heart for his or her suffering can be a big comfort.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Everyone you meet is a part of your journey, but not all of them are meant to stay in your life. Some people are just passing through to bring you gifts; either they're blessings or lessons.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: When each day is the same as the next, it’s because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: There is a way to be good again...
author: Khaled Hosseini
title: The Kite Runner

quote: The damage was permanent; there would always be scars. But even the angriest scars faded over time until it was difficult to see them written on the skin at all, and the only thing that remained was the memory of how painful it had been.
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: Count your blessings, not your problems. Count your own blessings, not someone else's. Remember that jealousy is when you count someone else's blessings instead of your own.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: Stop giving other people the power to control your happiness, your mind, and your life. If you don't take control of yourself and your own life, someone else is bound to try.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: There are two ways to reach me: by way of kisses or by way of the imagination. But there is a hierarchy: the kisses alone don't work.
author: Anaïs Nin
title: HENRY AND JUNE

quote: I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there.
author: David Mitchell
title: Cloud Atlas

quote: Swords can win territories but not hearts, forces can bend heads but not minds.
author: Mirza Tahir Ahmad

quote: Music melts all the separate parts of our bodies together.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: One Choice  One Choice, decided your friends.  One Choice, defines your beliefs.  One Choice, determines your loyalties - Forever.  ONCE CHOICE CAN TRANSFORM YOU
author: Veronica Roth
title: Divergent

quote: It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates.
author: Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

quote: Dumbledore will only leave from Hogwarts when there are none loyal to him!
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quote: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: People have to forgive. We don't have to like them, we don't have to be friends with them, we don't have to send them hearts in text messages, but we have to forgive them, to overlook, to forget. Because if we don't we are tying rocks to our feet, too much for our wings to carry!
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Just be yourself, there is no one better.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing  than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Be like the sun for grace and mercy. Be like the night to cover others' faults. Be like running water for generosity. Be like death for rage and anger. Be like the Earth for modesty. Appear as you are. Be as you appear.
author: Rumi

quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
author: John Wooden

quote: We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.
author: Stephen King
title: On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quote: If you have a strong purpose in life, you don't have to be pushed. Your passion will drive you there.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Don’t ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.
author: Howard Thurman

quote: Dream as if you will live forever; Live as if you will die today.
author: James  Dean

quote: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: There's so much to be grateful for, words are poor things.
author: Marilynne Robinson
title: Home

quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: If you dare nothing, then when the day is over, nothing is all you will have gained.
author: Neil Gaiman
title: The Graveyard Book

quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Without fear there cannot be courage.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: Patience Is Not the Ability to Wait:  Patience is not the ability to wait. Patience is to be calm no matter what happens, constantly take action to turn it to positive growth opportunities, and have faith to believe that it will all work out in the end while you are waiting.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
author: Napoleon Hill
title: Think and Grow Rich: A Black Choice

quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The Roycroft Dictionary Concocted By Ali Baba And The Bunch On Rainy Days

quote: I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: The windows of my soul I throw Wide open to the sun.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier
title: John Greenleaf Whittier's Poetry: An Appraisal and a Selection

quote: In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.
author: Anne Frank
title: The Diary of Anne Frank

quote: What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quote: If your feet are firmly planted on the ground you'll never be able to dance.
author: Iris Johansen
title: Countdown

quote: Fiction is art and art is the triumph over chaos… to celebrate a world that lies spread out around us like a bewildering and stupendous dream.
author: John Cheever

quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Meditations

quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make, And better friends I'll not be knowing, Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take, No matter where it's going.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
title: The Selected Poetry

quote: I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: I learned this, at least, by my experiment; that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours..
author: Thoreau, Henry David

quote: If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Do all the good you can, By all the means you can, In all the ways you can, In all the places you can, At all the times you can, To all the people you can, As long as ever you can.
author: John Wesley

quote: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Make a pact with yourself today to not be defined by your past. Sometimes the greatest thing to come out of all your hard work isn't what you get for it, but what you become for it. Shake things up today! Be You...Be Free...Share.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: But remember, boy, that a kind act can sometimes be as powerful as a sword.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Battle of the Labyrinth

quote: The strongest people find the courage and caring to help others, even if they are going through their own storm.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Since I was young, I have always known this: Life damages us, every one. We can’t escape that damage. But now, I am also learning this: We can be mended. We mend each other
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: The surest way to make your dreams come true is to live them.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.
author: Robert Frost

quote: What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: I'm not in search of sanctity, sacredness, purity; these things are found after this life, not in this life; but in this life I search to be completely human: to feel, to give, to take, to laugh, to get lost, to be found, to dance, to love and to lust, to be so human.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Getting something and having the wits to use it...those are two different things.
author: Rick Riordan
title: The Battle of the Labyrinth

quote: You will never be able to escape from your heart. So it's better to listen to what it has to say.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist

quote: If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose.
author: Gene Stratton-Porter
title: A Girl of the Limberlost

quote: People don't realize how a man's whole life can be changed by one book.
author: Malcolm X

quote: Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.
author: Jodi Picoult
title: Nineteen Minutes

quote: Nothing can disturb your peace of mind unless you allow it to.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: We come spinning out of nothingness, scattering stars like dust.
author: Rumi

quote: One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Kindness is not a business. True kindness expects nothing in return and should never act with conditions.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Be melting snow. Wash yourself of yourself.
author: Rumi
title: The Essential Rumi

quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.
author: Homer
title: The Odyssey

quote: What you have to decide... is how you want your life to be. If your forever was ending tomorrow, would this be how you'd want to have spent it? Listen, the truth is, nothing is guaranteed. You know that more than anybody. So dont be afraid. Be alive.
author: Sarah Dessen
title: The Truth About Forever

quote: To have what you have never had, you have to do what you have never done.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Live the Life of Your Dreams When you start living the life of your dreams, there will always be obstacles, doubters, mistakes and setbacks along the way. But with hard work, perseverance and self-belief there is no limit to what you can achieve.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Oh the places you'll go! There is fun to be done! There are points to be scored. There are games to be won. And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.
author: Dr. Seuss
title: Oh, The Places You’ll Go!

quote: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.
author: Mae West

quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist
