author: Lana Del Rey

quote: I choose gentleness... Nothing is won by force. I choose to be gentle. If I raise my voice may it be only in praise. If I clench my fist, may it be only in prayer. If I make a demand, may it be only of myself.
author: Max Lucado

quote: One of the best ways to influence people is to make them feel important.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time, who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done, if we are always doing.
author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Letters of Thomas Jefferson

quote: If you don't love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?
author: RuPaul

quote: If you have to dry the dishes  (Such an awful boring chore) If you have to dry the dishes ('Stead of going to the store) If you have to dry the dishes And you drop one on the floor Maybe they won't let you Dry the dishes anymore
author: Shel Silverstein
title: A Light in the Attic

quote: Pegang tanganku, tapi jangan terlalu erat, karena aku ingin seiring dan bukan digiring.(Spasi)
author: Dee
title: Filosofi Kopi: Kumpulan Cerita dan Prosa Satu Dekade

quote: Scars are not injuries, Tanner Sack. A scar is a healing. After injury, a scar is what makes you whole.
author: China Miéville
title: The Scar

quote: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn't anything you can't do if you want to.
author: Jim Henson
title: It's Not Easy Being Green: And Other Things to Consider

quote: The doubters said,  "Man can not fly,"  The doers said,  "Maybe, but we'll try,"  And finally soared  In the morning glow  While non-believers  Watched from below.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Associate Yourself with People Who Think Positively:  Associate yourself with people who think positively. You cannot surround yourself with negative people and expect positive outcomes.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: All men want, not something to do with, but something to do, or rather something to be.
author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Walden

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When a stargirl cries, she sheds not tears but light.
author: Jerry Spinelli
title: Stargirl

quote: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
author: Eckhart Tolle
title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment

quote: Freedom is a heavy load, a great and strange burden for the spirit to undertake. It is not easy. It is not a gift given, but a choice made, and the choice may be a hard one. The road goes upward towards the light; but the laden traveler may never reach the end of it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin
title: The Tombs of Atuan

quote: To learn something new, you need to try new things and not be afraid to be wrong.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: It doesn't matter what you do...so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away.
author: Ray Bradbury
title: Fahrenheit 451

quote: Children betrayed their parents by becoming their own people.
author: Leslye Walton
title: The Strange and Beautiful  Sorrows of Ava Lavender

quote: Intellectual growth should commence at birth and cease only at death.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you can't run, you crawl. If you can't crawl-- you find someone to carry you.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: The value of things is not the time they last, but the intensity with which they occur. That is why there are unforgettable moments and unique people!
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Sometimes, as we're stumbling along in the dark, we hit something good.
author: Susan Ee
title: Angelfall

quote: I try to avoid looking forward or backward, and try to keep looking upward.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: We all have two lives. The second one starts when we realize that we only have one.
author: Tom Hiddleston

quote: Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.
author: Jim Henson

quote: You can't outwit fate by standing on the sidelines placing little sidebets about the outcome of life. either you wade in and risk everything you have to play the game or you don't play at all. and if u don't play u can't win.
author: Judith McNaught
title: Paradise

quote: If I must fall, may it be from a high place.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept

quote: I’ve had many enemies over the years. If there’s one thing I’ve learned, it’s never engage in a fight you’re sure to lose. On the other hand, never let anyone who has insulted you get away with it. Bide your time and strike back when you’re in a position of strength—even if you no longer need to strike back.
author: Steig Larson
title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

quote: Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: As we go through life we gradually discover who we are, but the more we discover, the more we lose ourselves.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage

quote: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: First you jump off the cliff and build your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Always be yourself, there's no one better!
author: Selena Gomez

quote: You are not a victim. No matter what you have been through, you're still here. You may have been challenged, hurt, betrayed, beaten, and discouraged, but nothing has defeated you. You are still here! You have been delayed but not denied. You are not a victim, you are a victor. You have a history of victory.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Just because someone desires you, it does not mean that they value you.   Read it over.  Again.  Let those words resonate in your mind.
author: Nayyirah Waheed

quote: Every day People straighten up the hair, why not the heart?
author: che guevara

quote: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.
author: Leo Tolstoy
title: War and Peace

quote: Happiness is always there. You just have to choose to see it. There's no point dwelling in the dark and ignoring the light of the stars.
author: Carrie Hope Fletcher

quote: Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: I cannot compromise my respect for your love. You can keep your love, I will keep my respect.
author: Amit Kalantri
title: Wealth of Words

quote: With great power comes great responsibility.
author: Stan Lee

quote: Life is essentially an endless series of problems. The solution to one problem is merely the creation of another.
author: Mark  Manson
title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck: A Counterintuitive Approach to Living a Good Life

quote: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.
author: Michel Houellebecq

quote: Consistency is the true foundation of trust. Either keep your promises or do not make them.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: And I thought that all those little kids are going to grow up someday. And all of those little kids are going to do the things that we do. And they will all kiss someone someday. But for now, sledding is enough. I think it would be great if sledding were always enough, but it isn't.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Nothing ever really goes away--it just changes into something else. Something beautiful.
author: Sarah Ockler
title: Twenty Boy Summer

quote: We dance round in a ring and suppose, But the Secret sits in the middle and knows.
author: Robert Frost

quote: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.
author: Joyce Meyer
title: Any Minute

quote: The caged bird sings with a fearful trill, of things unknown, but longed for still,  and his tune is heard on the distant hill,  for the caged bird sings of freedom.
author: Maya Angelou
title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

quote: The function of freedom is to free someone else.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Deciding whether or not to trust a person is like deciding whether or not to climb a tree because you might get a wonderful view from the highest branch or you might simply get covered in sap and for this reason many people choose to spend their time alone and indoors where it is harder to get a splinter.
author: Lemony Snicket
title: The Penultimate Peril

quote: Only the gentle are ever really strong.
author: James  Dean

quote: Makakapili ka ng lugar na uupuan mo, pero hindi mo mapipili ang taong uupo sa puwang sa tabi mo... Ganyan ang senaryo sa bus. Ganyan din sa pag-ibig... Lalong 'di mo kontrolado kung kelan siya bababa.
author: Bob Ong

quote: Are you on our side...and want to be different, or are you on that side and want to throw a football at my head!?
author: Gerard Way

quote: Fear robs you of your freedom to make the right choice in life that can bridge the gap between where you are and where you want to be. On the other side of fear, lies freedom. If you want to grow, you need to be brave and take risks. If you're not uncomfortable, you're not growing.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life teaches us the right path is rarely the easy one.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Stay strong, stay positive, and never give up.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Gossip is just a tool to distract people who have nothing better to do from feeling jealous of those few of us still remaining with noble hearts.
author: Anna Godbersen
title: Splendor

quote: It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.
author: Jason Mraz

quote: The splendid thing about falling apart silently... is that you can start over as many times as you like.
author: Sanober Khan
title: A Thousand Flamingos

quote: What we do see depends mainly on what we look for. ... In the same field the farmer will notice the crop, the geologists the fossils, botanists the flowers, artists the colouring, sportmen the cover for the game. Though we may all look at the same things, it does not all follow that we should see them.
author: John Lubbock
title: The Beauties of Nature and the Wonders of the World We Live in

quote: Shine your light and make a positive impact on the world; there is nothing so honorable as helping improve the lives of others.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: But why think about that when all the golden lands ahead of you and all kinds of unforseen events wait lurking to surprise you and make you glad you're alive to see?
author: Jack Kerouac
title: On the Road

quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

quote: We do not get to choose when in our lives we feel pain," said Matthew. "It comes when it comes, and we try to remember, even though we cannot imagine a day when it will release its hold on us, that all pain fades. All misery passes. Humanity is drawn to light, not darkness.
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Chain of Gold

quote: I love you, in my mind where my thoughts reside, in my heart where my emotions live, and in my soul where my dreams are born. I love you.
author: Dee Henderson
title: The Healer

quote: Chaos is more freedom; in fact, total freedom. But no meaning. I want to be free to act, and I also want my actions to mean something.
author: Audrey Niffenegger
title: The Time Traveler's Wife

quote: Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.
author: Bob Marley

quote: If you can't you must, and if you must you can.
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: No one is ever satisfied where he is.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: Dream your own dreams, achieve your own goals. Your journey is your own and unique.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Sticking feathers up your butt does not make you a chicken!
author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: Fight Club

quote: There isn't time, so brief is life, for bickerings, apologies, heartburnings, callings to account. There is only time for loving, and but an instant, so to speak, for that.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When I hear music, I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times, and to the latest.
author: HENRY DAVID THOREAU

quote: Life,” said Marvin dolefully, “loathe it or ignore it, you can’t like it.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery it is. In the boredom and pain of it, no less than in the excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to the holy and hidden heart of it, because in the last analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is grace.
author: Frederick Buechner
title: NOW & THEN

quote: Written words can also sing.
author: Ngũgĩ wa Thiong’o
title: Dreams in a Time of War

quote: An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: You were not born on earth to please anyone; you have to live life to express yourself, not to impress someone. Don't pretend to be someone you're not, and never lose yourself in search of other people's acceptance and approval.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Be with someone who inspires you and makes you be the best version of yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The greatest step towards a life of simplicity is to learn to let go.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: The right thing at the wrong tme is the wrong thing.
author: Joshua Harris
title: I Kissed Dating Goodbye

quote: Awake, arise or be for ever fall’n.
author: John Milton
title: Paradise Lost

quote: There is nothing more beautiful than seeing a person being themselves. Imagine going through your day being unapologetically you.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: I am who I am; no more, no less.
author: Terry Goodkind
title: Wizard's First Rule

quote: Indeed, learning to write may be part of learning to read. For all I know, writing comes out of a superior devotion to reading.
author: Eudora Welty
title: On Writing

quote: Facing it, always facing it, that’s the way to get through. Face it.
author: Conrad Joseph

quote: it is impossible to build one's own happiness on the unhappiness of others. This perspective is at the heart of Buddhist teachings.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp, Or what's a heaven for?
author: Robert Browning
title: Men and Women and Other Poems

quote: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
author: John Lennon

quote: Anything is possible. Anything can be.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: You can’t go back and make a new start, but you can start right now and make a brand new ending.
author: James R. Sherman
title: Rejection

quote: If you live in a past dream, you don't enjoy what is happening right now because you will always wish it to be different than it is. There is no time to miss anyone or anything because you are alive. Not enjoying what is happening right now is living in the past and being only half alive. This leads to self pity, suffering and tears.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
title: The Four Agreements

quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Great Leaders Create More Leaders  Good leaders have vision and inspire others to help them turn vision into reality. Great leaders create more leaders, not followers. Great leaders have vision, share vision, and inspire others to create their own.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Do not wait: the time will never be 'just right'. Start where you stand, and work whatever tools you may have at your command and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other... I know I've spent each life before this one searching for you. Not someone like you but you, for your soul and mine must always come together.
author: Nicholas Sparks
title: The Notebook

quote: I am what I am, an’ I’m not ashamed. 'Never be ashamed,’ my ol’ dad used ter say, ‘there’s some who’ll hold it against you, but they’re not worth botherin’ with.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quote: no matter how ugly the world gets or how stupid it shows me it is, I always have faith
author: Gerard Way

quote: My Dear, Find what you love and let it kill you. Let it drain you of your all. Let it cling onto your back and weigh you down into eventual nothingness. Let it kill you and let it devour your remains. For all things will kill you, both slowly and fastly, but it's much better to be killed by a lover. -Falsely yours
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: I give myself a good cry if I need it. But then I concentrate on the good things still in my life. I don't allow myself any more self-pity than that. A little each every morning, a few tears, and that's all.
author: Mitch Albom
title: Tuesdays with Morrie

quote: You have every right to a beautiful life.
author: Selena Gomez

quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
author: Richard Bach

quote: No man ever threw away life while it was worth keeping.
author: David Hume
title: Essays on Suicide and the Immortality of the Soul

quote: The past can't hurt you anymore. Not unless you let it. They made you into a victim, Evey. They made you into a statistic. But, that's not the real you. That's not who you are inside.
author: Alan Moore
title: V for Vendetta

quote: Every choice comes with a consequence. Once you make a choice, you must accept responsibility. You cannot escape the consequences of your choices, whether you like them or not.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Difficulties and adversities viciously force all their might on us and cause us to fall apart, but they are necessary elements of individual growth and reveal our true potential. We have got to endure and overcome them, and move forward. Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: How much you can learn when you fail determines how far you will go into achieving your goals.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Push your boundaries beyond the ordinary; be that “extra” in “extraordinary.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Opinion is really the lowest form of human knowledge. It requires no accountability, no understanding. The highest form of knowledge… is empathy, for it requires us to suspend our egos and live in another’s world. It requires profound purpose larger than the self kind of understanding.
author: Bill Bullard

quote: Success is determined not by whether or not you face obstacles, but by your reaction to them. And if you look at these obstacles as a containing fence, they become your excuse for failure. If you look at them as a hurdle, each one strengthens you for the next.
author: Ben Carson
title: Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story

quote: Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
title: Anne of Green Gables

quote: Myth is much more important and true than history. History is just journalism and you know how reliable that is.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: a wind has blown the rain away & the sky away & all the leaves away, & the trees stand. i think i, too, have known autumn too long.
author: e.e. cummings

quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world
author: Helen Keller

quote: Give up to grace. The ocean takes care of each wave 'til it gets to shore. You need more help than you know.
author: Rumi
title: Words of Paradise: Selected Poems of Rumi

quote: Tolerance of intolerance is cowardice.
author: Ayaan Hirsi Ali

quote: ...Despite the mayhem that followed, Bruno found that he was still holding Shmuel's hand in his own and nothing in the world would have persuaded him to let go.
author: John Boyne
title: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas

quote: For all those that have to fight for the respect that everyone else is given without question.
author: N.K. Jemisin
title: The Fifth Season

quote: Courage does not always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

quote: There comes a time when we realize that our parents cannot save themselves or save us, that everyone who wades through time eventually gets dragged out to sea by the undertow- that, in short, we are all going.
author: John Green
title: Looking for Alaska

quote: Death is the easy part, the hard part is living and knowing you could be so much more then you’re willing to be.
author: robert m drake

quote: No, our science is no illusion. But an illusion it would be to suppose that what science cannot give us we can get elsewhere.
author: Sigmund Freud
title: The Future of an Illusion

quote: Anxiety is the handmaiden of creativity
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: If the only prayer you say throughout your life is "Thank You," then that will be enough.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: It serves me right for putting all my eggs in one bastard.
author: Dorothy Parker
title: You Might As Well Live: The Life and Times of Dorothy Parker

quote: Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All the problem of women, starts with men. All the problem of men, ends with women.
author: Santosh Kalwar
title: Quote Me Everyday

quote: Those three things - autonomy, complexity, and a connection between effort and reward - are, most people will agree, the three qualities that work has to have if it is to be satisfying.
author: Malcolm Gladwell
title: Outliers: The Story of Success

quote: The further you go, the more you have to be proud of. At the same time, in order to come a long way, you have to be behind to begin with. IN the end, though maybe it's not how you reach a place that matters. Just that you get there at all.
author: Sarah Dessen
title: Lock and Key

quote: Change course, but don’t give up.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Do your own thing on your own terms and get what you came here for
author: Oliver James

quote: The language of Friendship is not words, but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A Week on the Concord and Merrimack Rivers

quote: Consider it: every person you have ever met, every person will suffer the loss of his friends and family. All are going to lose everything they love in this world. Why would one want to be anything but kind to them in the meantime?
author: Sam Harris
title: The End of Faith: Religion, Terror, and the Future of Reason

quote: I wish I could've lived my life without making any wrong turns. But that's impossible. A path like that doesn't exist. We fail. We trip. We get lost. We make mistakes. And little by little, one step at a time, we push forward. It's all we can do. On our own two feet.
author: Natsuki Takaya
title: Fruits Basket, Vol. 21

quote: Anyone who knows me, should learn to know me again; For I am like the Moon, you will see me with new face everyday.
author: Rumi

quote: Don't marry a rich man. Marry a good man. He will spend his life trying to keep you happy. No rich man can buy that!
author: Staness Jonekos

quote: If I've learned one lesson from all that's happened to me, it's that there is no such thing as the biggest mistake of your existence. There's no such thing as ruining your life. Life's a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.
author: Sophie Kinsella
title: The Undomestic Goddess

quote: Mutual caring relationships require kindness and patience, tolerance, optimism, joy in the other's achievements, confidence in oneself, and the ability to give without undue thought of gain.
author: Fred Rogers
title: The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember

quote: The beauty of the world...has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy for ever:  Its loveliness increases; it will never  Pass into nothingness; but still will keep  A bower quiet for us, and a sleep  Full of sweet dreams, and health, and quiet breathing.
author: John Keats

quote: Living well is an art that can be developed: a love of life and ability to take great pleasure from small offerings and assurance that the world owes you nothing and that every gift is exactly that, a gift.
author: Maya Angelou
title: Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now

quote: Love those you hate you.
author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Anna Karenina

quote: It is not worth the while to let our imperfections disturb us always.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Grace is the face that love wears when it meets imperfection.
author: Joseph R. Cooke

quote: When you're screwing up and nobody says anything to you anymore, that means they've given up on you.
author: Randy Pausch

quote: With your head full of brains and your shoes full of feet, you're too smart to go down any not-so-good street.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I wonder,” he said, “whether the stars are set alight in heaven so that one day each one of us may find his own again...
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: The Little Prince

quote: We are all of us born with a letter inside us, and that only if we are true to ourselves, may we be allowed to read it before we die.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: If you surrendered to the air, you could ride it.
author: Toni Morrison
title: Song of Solomon

quote: If you're not comfortable enough with yourself or with your own truth when entering a relationship, then you're not ready for that relationship.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: It is much easier to be brave if you do not know everything.
author: Lois Lowry

quote: One of the pitfalls of childhood is that one doesn't have to understand something to feel it. By the time the mind is able to comprehend what has happened, the wounds of the heart are already too deep.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
title: The Shadow of the Wind

quote: that as long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: A Nation should not be judged by how it treats its highest citizens, but it's lowest ones
author: Nelson Mandela
title: Long Walk to Freedom

quote: In case you never get a second chance: don't be afraid!" "And what if you do get a second chance?" "You take it!
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Be comforted, dear soul! There is always light behind the clouds.
author: Louisa May Alcott
title: Little Women

quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
author: Wil Zeus
title: Sun Beyond the Clouds

quote: When you take risks you learn that there will be times when you succeed and there will be times when you fail, and both are equally important.
author: Ellen DeGeneres
title: Seriously... I'm Kidding

quote: The decisions I made after that moment were not the ones she would have made. They were the choices of a changed person, a new self.   You could call this selfhood many things. Transformation. Metamorphosis. Falsity. Betrayal.   I call it an education
author: Tara Westover
title: Educated

quote: I believe in the immeasurable power of love; that true love can endure any circumstance and reach across any distance.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: The purpose of literature is to turn blood into ink.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: By hook or by crook, I hope that you will possess yourselves of money enough to travel and to idle, to contemplate the future or the past of the world, to dream over books and loiter at street corners and let the line of thought dip deep into the stream
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Otto Rank

quote: The harder you fall, the heavier your heart; the heavier your heart, the stronger you climb; the stronger you climb, the higher your pedestal.
author: Criss Jami
title: Killosophy

quote: Make voyages. Attempt them. There's nothing else.
author: Tennesse Williams
title: Camino Real

quote: In our world," said Eustace, "a star is a huge ball of flaming gas." Even in your world, my son, that is not what a star is, but only what it is made of.
author: C.S. Lewis
title: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader

quote: Dream, Dream Dream Dreams transform into thoughts  And thoughts result in action.
author: APJ ABDUL KALAM

quote: Collective madness is called sanity ..
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Veronika Decides to Die

quote: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I do not believe that sheer suffering teaches. If suffering alone taught, all the world would be wise, since everyone suffers. To suffering must be added mourning, understanding, patience, love, openness, and the willingness to remain vulnerable.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
title: Gift from the Sea

quote: No one has ever achieved greatness without dreams.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: The most exquisite paradox… as soon as you give it all up, you can have it all. As long as you want power, you can't have it. The minute you don't want power, you'll have more than you ever dreamed possible.
author: ram dass

quote: Free yourself from the complexities and drama of your life. Simplify. Look within. Within ourselves we all have the gifts and talents we need to fulfill the purpose we've been blessed with.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Live boldly. Push yourself. Don't settle.
author: Jojo Moyes
title: Me Before You

quote: Millions saw the apple fall, Newton was the only one who asked why?
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: What if I mess up?"  "Oh, you will. You'll mess up, you'll make mistakes, you'll break things. Some you'll be able to piece together, and others you'll lose. That's all a given. But there's only one thing you have to do for me."  "What's that?"  "Stay alive long enough to mess up again.
author: Victoria Schwab
title: The Archived

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: All the time you're saying to yourself, 'I could do that, but I won't,' — which is just another way of saying that you can't.
author: Richard P. Feynman
title: Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!: Adventures of a Curious Character

quote: We hunt the flame, the light in the darkness, the good this world deserves.
author: Hafsah Faizal
title: We Hunt the Flame

quote: If it sounds like writing, I rewrite it.
author: Elmore Leonard
title: Elmore Leonard's 10 Rules of Writing

quote: Don't find fault, find a remedy; anybody can complain
author: Henry Ford

quote: Life will hit you hard in the face, wait for you to get back up just so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air.
author: Sarah Kay

quote: Laughter is carbonated holiness.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Love art in yourself, and not yourself in art.
author: Constantin Stanislavski
title: My Life In Art

quote: Love demands everything, they say, but my love demands only this: that no matter what happens or how long it takes, you`ll keep faith in me, you`ll remember who we are, and you`ll never feel despair.
author: Ann Brashares
title: My Name Is Memory

quote: A winner is a dreamer who never gives up
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Find a purpose to serve, not a lifestyle to live.
author: Criss Jami
title: Venus in Arms

quote: Failures are the stairs we climb to reach success.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Two things fill the mind with ever-increasing wonder and awe, the more often and the more intensely the mind of thought is drawn to them: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.
author: Immanuel Kant
title: Critique of Practical Reason

quote: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.
author: E.M. Forster
title: What I Believe and Other Essays

quote: You can have everything you want if you can put your heart and soul into everything you do.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: I want to continue being crazy; living my life the way I dream it, and not the way the other people want it to be.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Veronika Decides to Die

quote: If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Create a vision for the life you really want and then work relentlessly towards making it a reality.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Yes, I have tricks in my pocket, I have things up my sleeve. But I am the opposite of a stage magician. He gives you illusion that has the appearance of truth. I give you truth in the pleasant disguise of illusion.
author: Tennessee Williams
title: The Glass Menagerie

quote: You know, the mind is a remarkable thing. Just because you can't see the wound doesn't mean it isn't hurting. It scars all the time, but it heals.
author: Jodi Picoult
title: The Pact

quote: If someone does not want me it is not the end of the world. But if I do not want me, the world is nothing but endings.
author: Nayyirah Waheed

quote: You are never too old to set another goal, or to dream a new dream.
author: Les Brown
title: Live Your Dreams

quote: You have to, take a deep breath. and allow the music to flow through you. Revel in it, allow yourself to awe. When you play allow the music to break your heart with its beauty.
author: Kelly White

quote: When we blindly adopt a religion, a political system, a literary dogma, we become automatons.
author: Anaïs Nin
title: The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 4: 1944-1947

quote: What's most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.  [Quoting Reverend Phillips Brooks, during Remarks at Presidential Prayer Breakfast, February 7 1963]
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Just because you fall once, doesn't mean you're fall at everything. Keep trying, hold on, and always trust yourself, because if you don't then who will??
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I don't know, I don't want to talk as much. (...) It's nicer to think dear, pretty thoughts and keep them in one's heart, like treasures. I don't like to have them laughed at or wondered over.
author: L.M. Montgomery
title: Anne of Green Gables

quote: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
author: Stephen King

quote: Nikolai had been told that hope was dangerous, had been warned of it many times. But he’d never believed that. Hope was the wind that came from nowhere to fill your sails and carry you home.
author: Leigh Bardugo
title: King of Scars

quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.
author: Anatole France
title: The Crime of Sylvestre Bonnard

quote: How would your life be different if…You stopped worrying about things you can’t control and started focusing on the things you can? Let today be the day…You free yourself from fruitless worry, seize the day and take effective action on things you can change.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Have you ever seen the stars in the night? See them closely, they will tell you, how to be open, how to love and how to shine and twinkle without any differences and jealousy of other stars.
author: Santosh Kalwar
title: Quote Me Everyday

quote: You should never assume. You know what happens when you assume. You make an ass out of you and me because that's how it's spelled.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Why are you trying so hard to fit in when you were born to stand out?
author: Ian Wallace

quote: Believe in yourself and there will come a day when others will have no choice but to believe with you.
author: Cynthia Kersey

quote: May I share with you a formula that in my judgment will help you and help me to journey well through mortality... First, fill your mind with truth; second, fill your life with service; and third, fill your heart with love.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: To write is human, to edit is divine.
author: Stephen King
title: On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quote: Be an Encourager: When you encourage others, you boost their self-esteem, enhance their self-confidence, make them work harder, lift their spirits and make them successful in their endeavors. Encouragement goes straight to the heart and is always available. Be an encourager. Always.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: You can have many great ideas in your head, but what makes the difference is the action. Without action upon an idea, there will be no manifestation, no results, and no reward
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
title: The Four Agreements

quote: I'm beginning to think that maybe it's not just how much you love someone. Maybe what matters is who you are when you're with them.
author: Anne Tyler
title: The Accidental Tourist

quote: No matter how much experience you have, there’s always something new you can learn and room for improvement.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: People would rather believe than know.
author: Edward O. Wilson

quote: Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion, follow humbly wherever and to whatever abysses nature leads, or you shall learn nothing. I have only begun to learn content and peace of mind since I have resolved at all risks to do this.
author: Thomas Huxley
title: Life and Letters of Thomas Henry Huxley — Volume 1

quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you will ever have.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: It was the moment I realized what music can do to people, how it can make you hurt and feel so good all at once.
author: Nina LaCour
title: Hold Still

quote: Do not give way to useless alarm; though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain.
author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice

quote: In the end, just three things matter:  How well we have lived How well we have loved How well we have learned to let go
author: Jack Kornfield

quote: We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, handsome, talented and fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?
author: Marianne Williamson
title: A Return to Love: Reflections on the Principles of "A Course in Miracles"

quote: Be where you are, stop over-thinking, and focus on what you are doing.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: To be in your children's memories tomorrow, You have to be in their lives today.
author: Barbara Johnson

quote: It takes a huge effort to free yourself from memory
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Aleph

quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you ‘love’ your neighbor; act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone, you will presently come to love him.
author: C. S.  Lewis
title: Mere Christianity

quote: ...even a tiny bit of deceit is dishonorable when it's used for selfish or cowardly reasons.  - Mr. Penderwick
author: Jeanne Birdsall
title: The Penderwicks on Gardam Street

quote: Everyone has his own reality in which, if one is not too cautious, timid or frightened, one swims. This is the only reality there is.
author: Henry Miller
title: Stand Still Like the Hummingbird

quote: If a bullet should enter my brain, let that bullet destroy every closet door.
author: Harvey Milk

quote: Although I am a typical loner in my daily life, my awareness of belonging to the invisible community of those who strive for truth, beauty, and justice has prevented me from feelings of isolation.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Life is painful. It has thorns, like the stem of a rose. Culture and art are the roses that bloom on the stem. The flower is yourself, your humanity. Art is the liberation of the humanity inside yourself.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
author: Virginia Woolf
title: A Writer's Diary

quote: Berhenti bercita-cita adalah tragedi terbesar dalam hidup manusia
author: Andrea Hirata
title: Sang Pemimpi

quote: A man, though wise, should never be ashamed of learning more, and must unbend his mind.
author: Sophocles
title: Antigone

quote: All shall be done, but it may be harder than you think.
author: C.S. Lewis
title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and all time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: That's everyone's dream, isn't it, really? Instead of many who give you little pieces of themselves-one who gives you everything.
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Chain of Gold

quote: Man cannot possess anything as long as he fears death. But to him who does not fear it, everything belongs. If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy
title: War and Peace

quote: It is only with true love and compassion that we can begin to mend what is broken in the world. It is these two blessed things that can begin to heal all broken hearts.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Do not let your negative thoughts have power over you because those thoughts will end up controlling your life. No one can live a positive life with a negative mind.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Everything changed the day she figured out there was exactly enough time for the important things in her life.
author: Brian Andreas

quote: Everything happens for a reason and, something better will come along for me!
author: Selena Gomez

quote: Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton.
author: Don Roff

quote: Focus on making yourself better, not on thinking that you are better.
author: Bohdi Sanders
title: The Secrets of Worldly Wisdom: Your Key to Unlocking Success

quote: It's just that in the Deep South, women learn at a young age that when the world is falling apart around you, it's time to take down the drapes and make a new dress.
author: Karen Moning
title: Faefever

quote: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Frustration and Love can’t exist in the same place at the same time, so get real and start doing what you would rather be doing in life. Love your life. All of it. Even the heavy shit that happened to you when you were 8. All of it was and IS perfect.
author: Jason Mraz

quote: I hate you." I love you." You're a freak, you know that? Everyone says so. They always have." I'm trying not to be.
author: Stephen Chbosky
title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Those with a grateful mindset tend to see the message in the mess. And even though life may knock them down, the grateful find reasons, if even small ones, to get up.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: This place is a dream. Only a sleeper considers it real. Then death comes like dawn, and you wake up laughing at what you thought was your grief.
author: Rumi

quote: It is better for the heart to break, than not to break.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: A gift is pure when it is given from the heart to the right person at the right time and at the right place, and when we expect nothing in return
author: Anonymous
title: The Bhagavad Gita

quote: Passion is a feeling that tells you: this is the right thing to do. Nothing can stand in my way. It doesn't matter what anyone else says. This feeling is so good that it cannot be ignored. I'm going to follow my bliss and act upon this glorious sensation of joy.
author: Wayne W. Dyer

quote: Where you stumble and fall, there you will find gold.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Life is short. If you doubt me, ask a butterfly. Their average life span is a mere five to fourteen days.
author: Ellen DeGeneres
title: The Funny Thing Is...

quote: WATNEY: Look! A pair of boobs! -> (.Y.).
author: Andy Weir
title: The Martian

quote: Write while the heat is in you. The writer who postpones the recording of his thoughts uses an iron which has cooled to burn a hole with. He cannot inflame the minds of his audience.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: I've had it with being nice, understanding, fair and hopeful. I feel like being negative all day. The chip on my shoulder could sink the QE2. I've got an attitude problem and nobody better get in my way...I'm in a bad mood and the whole stupid little world is gonna pay!
author: John Waters
title: Crackpot: The Obsessions of John Waters

quote: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.
author: J. Krishnamurti

quote: But in the end it's only a passing thing, this shadow; even darkness must pass.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Lord of the Rings

quote: The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained by sudden flight, but they, while their companions slept, were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Everything you want is on the other side of fear.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: How satisfying it is to leave a mark on a blank surface. To make a map of my movement - no matter how temporary.
author: Craig Thompson
title: Blankets

quote: When they say the sky's the limit to me that's really true
author: Michael  Jackson

quote: We humans do not understand compassion. In each moment of our lives, we betray it. Aye, we know of its worth, yet in knowing we then attach to it a value, we guard the giving of it, believing it must be earned, T’lan Imass. Compassion is priceless in the truest sense of the word. It must be given freely. In abundance.
author: Steven Erikson
title: Memories of Ice

quote: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: This is My Story

quote: I was born into Bolívar's labyrinth, and so I must believe in the hope of Rabelais' Great Perhaps.
author: John Green

quote: Your Life Is Happening Right Now: Don't let procrastination take over your life. Be brave and take risks. Your life is happening right now.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I'd like to add some beauty to life," said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born.
author: L.M. Montgomery
title: Anne's House of Dreams

quote: The deepest secret is that life is not a process of discovery, but a process of creation. You are not discovering yourself, but creating yourself anew. Seek therefore, not to find out Who You Are, but seek to determine Who You Want to Be.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

quote: Remind thyself, in the darkest moments, that every failure is only a step toward success, every detection of what is false directs you toward what is true, every trial exhausts some tempting form of error, and every adversity will only hide, for a time, your path to peace and fulfillment.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Am I weird?"  "Yeah. But so what? Everybody's weird.
author: Stephen King
title: The Body

quote: You can't find someone who doesn't want to be found.
author: Isabel Allende
title: The House of the Spirits

quote: To invent your own life's meaning is not easy, but it's still allowed, and I think you'll be happier for the trouble.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Every time you do a good deed you shine the light a little farther into the dark. And the thing is, when you're gone that light is going to keep shining on, pushing the shadows back.
author: charles de lint

quote: Pac said Thug Life stood for 'The Hate U Give Little Infants Fucks Everybody'.
author: Angie Thomas
title: The Hate U Give

quote: Know from whence you came. If you know whence you came, there are absolutely no limitations to where you can go.
author: James Baldwin

quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Never let a problem to be solved, become more important than a person to be loved.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: Don't waste your energy trying to change opinions ... Do your thing, and don't care if they like it.
author: Tina Fey
title: Bossypants

quote: If you care about something enough, you'll find a way to make it happen.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: There's a hunger for stories in all of us, adults too. We need stories so much that we're even willing to read bad books to get them, if the good books won't supply them.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: It's your life-but only if you make it so.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: You Learn by Living: Eleven Keys for a More Fulfilling Life

quote: No man is brave that has never walked a hundred miles. If you want to know the truth of who you are, walk until not a person knows your name. Travel is the great leveler, the great teacher, bitter as medicine, crueler than mirror-glass. A long stretch of road will teach you more about yourself than a hundred years of quiet.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: A thousand words leave not the same deep impression as does a single deed.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: It's a lie to think you're not good enough. It's a lie to think you're not worth anything.
author: Nick Vujicic

quote: No matter how hard life is, don't lose hope
author: Zayn Malik

quote: Everything stinks till it’s finished.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: There is no more profitable investment than investing in yourself. It is the best investment you can make; you can never go wrong with it. It is the true way to improve yourself to be the best version of you and lets you be able to best serve those around you.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: To overcome fear is the quickest way to gain your self-confidence.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: I’ve gotta get out of the basement. I’ve gotta see the world. I’ve gotta make a difference
author: Gerard Way

quote: Be careful the stories you're telling yourself about your current circumstances; a head full of negative thoughts has no space for positive ones.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
author: Thomas à Kempis
title: The Imitation of Christ

quote: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: But we never get back our youth… The pulse of joy that beats in us at twenty becomes sluggish. Our limbs fail, our senses rot. We degenerate into hideous puppets, haunted by the memory of the passions of which we were too much afraid, and the exquisite temptations that we had not the courage to yield to.
author: Oscar Wilde
title: The Picture of Dorian Gray

quote: She had been given a wonderful gift: life. Sometimes it was cruelly taken away too soon, but it's what you did with it that counted, not how long it lasted.
author: Cecelia Ahern
title: P.S. I Love You

quote: When forever becomes a place...when forever ceases to be just a word… when it ceases to be just a measurement of time…but instead becomes a place where soul mates can dance to the song in their hearts... that is a reflection of true love.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Your own Self-Realization is the greatest service you can render the world.
author: Ramana Maharshi

quote: These mountains that you are carrying, you were only supposed to climb.
author: Najwa Zebian

quote: We're so engaged in doing things to achieve purposes of outer value that we forget the inner value, the rapture that is associated with being alive, is what it is all about.
author: Joseph Campbell
title: The Power of Myth

quote: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Yoga is not a religion. It is a science, science of well-being, science of youthfulness, science of integrating body, mind and soul.
author: Amit Ray
title: Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style

quote: I'm not going to limit myself just because people won't accept the fact that I can do something else.
author: Dolly Parton

quote: life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity, & stumble from defeat to defeat.
author: anaïs nin

quote: She's a woman, you're a dude. You're not supposed to understand her. That's not what she's after.... She doesn't want you to understand her. She knows that's impossible. She just wants you to understand yourself. Everything else is negotiable.
author: Neal Stephenson
title: Snow Crash

quote: I don’t chase after anyone, If you wanna walk out of my life, then I’ll hold the fucking door open for you.
author: Wiz Khalifa

quote: Every problem is a gift - without problems we would not grow.
author: Anthony Robbins

quote: Talent is a gift, but character is a choice.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: There's some good in this world, Mr. Frodo, and it's worth fighting for.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: We are the cosmos made conscious and life is the means by which the universe understands itself.
author: Brian Cox

quote: My only regrets are the moments when i doubted myself and took the safe route. Life is too short to waste time being unhappy.
author: Dan Howell

quote: I'm starting with the man in the mirror, I'm asking him to change his ways; And no message could have been any clearer, If you wanna make the world a better place, Take a look at yourself, and then make a change!
author: Michael  Jackson

quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We need to help people to discover the true meaning of love. Love is generally confused with dependence. Those of us who have grown in true love know that we can love only in proportion to our capacity for independence.
author: Fred Rogers
title: The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember

quote: You've got to show the world who you are before it tells you. Otherwise you become victim to someone you're not.
author: Chris Colfer
title: Struck By Lightning: The Carson Phillips Journal

quote: Tearing down the rest of the world won't make you happy. Look inside yourself. Because finding who you were meant to be? What you were put into this world to do? That's what fills the emptiness. It's the only things that can.
author: A.G. Howard
title: Splintered

quote: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: I am the captain of my soul.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: This is the key to life: To expect everything to be given to you from above, yet to be genuinely surprised and forever grateful, when they are. Expecting all good things to be yours, while not knowing how to take anything for granted. If there may be a key in life, this is the key.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The deeds you do may be the only sermon some persons will hear today
author: St. Francis Of Assisi

quote: Perfect is the enemy of good.
author: Voltaire

quote: Ten spears go to battle," he whispered, "and nine shatter. Did the war forge the one that remained? No, Amaran. All the war did was identify the spear that would not break.
author: Brandon Sanderson
title: Oathbringer

quote: If you are under the impression you have already perfected yourself, you will never rise to the heights you are no doubt capable of.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
title: The Remains of the Day

quote: Argue for your limitations and, sure enough, they're yours.
author: Richard Bach
title: Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quote: The trick is to enjoy life. Don't wish away your days, waiting for better ones ahead.
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

quote: There is great change to be experienced once you learn the power of letting go. Stop allowing anyone or anything to control, limit, repress, or discourage you from being your true self! Today is YOURS to shape - own it - break free from people and things that poison or dilute your spirit.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: The point of stories is not that they are objectively true, but that the soul of the story is truer than reality. Those who mock fiction do so because they fear the truth.
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Chain of Gold

quote: As soon as you honor the present moment, all unhappiness and struggle dissolve, and life begins to flow with joy and ease. When you act out the present-moment awareness, whatever you do becomes imbued with a sense of quality, care, and love - even the most simple action.
author: Eckhart Tolle
title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment

quote: Finding one important thing in your life doesn’t mean you have to give up all the other important things.
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Brida

quote: To those who abuse: the sin is yours, the crime is yours, and the shame is yours. To those who protect the perpetrators: blaming the victims only masks the evil within, making you as guilty as those who abuse. Stand up for the innocent or go down with the rest.
author: Flora Jessop
title: Church of Lies

quote: Find the things that matter, and hold on to them, and fight for them, and refuse to let them go.
author: Lauren Oliver
title: Delirium

quote: Your complaints, your drama, your victim mentality, your whining, your blaming, and all of your excuses have NEVER gotten you even a single step closer to your goals or dreams. Let go of your nonsense. Let go of the delusion that you DESERVE better and go EARN it! Today is a new day!
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Rise to the occassion which is life!
author: Virginia Euwer Wolff

quote: All worthy work is open to interpretations the author did not intend. Art isn't your pet -- it's your kid. It grows up and talks back to you.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: Normalness leads to sadness.
author: Phil Lester

quote: Do not let those who cannot see the truth tell you who you are. You are the flame that cannot be put out. You are the star that cannot be lost. You are who you have always been, and that is enough and more than enough. Anyone who looks at you and sees darkness is blind.
author: Cassandra Clare
title: Chain of Gold

quote: Whether a thought is spoken or not it is a real thing and it has power," Tuek said. "You might find the line between life and death among the Fremen to be too sharp and quick.
author: Frank Herbert
title: Dune

quote: You have to be the bravest person in the world to go out every day, being yourself when no one likes who you are.
author: Matthew Dicks
title: Memoirs of an Imaginary Friend

quote: Hard work beats talent when talent fails to work hard.
author: Kevin Durant

quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame.
author: Stephen King

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Accepting oneself does not preclude an attempt to become better.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: I don't understand dating.. and the other things that people do.. all I know is that you ought to find the one you recognize. The one who gives you four arms, four legs, four eyes, and has the other half of your heart. There's only one of those, so what are all the other things for? Like dating?
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: When I left Queen's my future seemed to stretch out before me like a straight road. I thought I could see along it for many a milestone. Now there is a bend in it. I don't know what lies around the bend, but I'm going to believe that the best does.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
title: Anne of Green Gables

quote: Il n'y a de réalité que dans l'action.  (There is no reality except in action.)
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: Existentialism is a Humanism

quote: Life is going to give you just what you put in it. Put your whole heart in everything you do, and pray, then you can wait.
author: Maya Angelou
title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

quote: Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Your own positive future begins in this moment. All you have is right now. Every goal is possible from here.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Fear tends to come from ignorance. Once I knew what the problem was, it was just a problem, nothing to fear.
author: Patrick Rothfuss
title: The Name of the Wind

quote: The great secret of true success, of true happiness, is this: the man or woman who asks for no return, the perfectly unselfish person, is the most successful.
author: Vivekananda

quote: Let us try to teach generosity and altruism, because we are born selfish. Let us understand what our own selfish genes are up to, because we may then at least have the chance to upset their designs, something that no other species has ever aspired to do.
author: Richard Dawkins
title: The Selfish Gene

quote: Complain and remain. Praise and be raised.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved.
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: It is quite a revelation to discover that the place you wanted to escape to is the exact same place you escaped from. That the prison wasn't the place, but the perspective.
author: Matt Haig
title: The Midnight Library

quote: An idea is salvation by imagination
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand--and melting like a snowflake...
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must — at that moment — become the center of the universe.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Smile at strangers and you just might change a life.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Whatever you see you gotta keep a sense of humor; you gotta be able to smile through all the bullshit.
author: Tupac Shakur

quote: Who belonged to no one, who belonged to everyone. Who had nothing, who wanted everything.
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: One more dance along the razor's edge finished. Almost dead yesterday, maybe dead tomorrow, but alive, gloriously alive, today.
author: Robert Jordan
title: Lord of Chaos

quote: Instead of worrying about what could go wrong, change your thoughts to what could go right. When you change the negative thought into a positive one, it eliminates the negative one.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Before I go," he said, and paused -- "I may kiss her?"  It was remembered afterwards that when he bent down and touched her face with his lips, he murmured some words. The child, who was nearest to him, told them afterwards, and told her grandchildren when she was a handsome old lady, that she heard him say, "A life you love.
author: Charles Dickens
title: A Tale of Two Cities

quote: The adventure of life is to learn.  The purpose of life is to grow.  The nature of life is to change.  The challenge of life is to overcome.  The essence of life is to care.  The opportunity of like is to serve.  The secret of life is to dare.  The spice of life is to befriend.  The beauty of life is to give.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.
author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Walden, or Life in the Woods

quote: The motive behind criticism often determines its validity. Those who care criticize where necessary. Those who envy criticize the moment they think that they have found a weak spot.
author: Criss Jami
title: Killosophy

quote: It's not that some people have willpower and some don't... It's that some people are ready to change and others are not.
author: James Gordon

quote: Don't ever give up.  Don't ever give in.  Don't ever stop trying.  Don't ever sell out.  And if you find yourself succumbing to one of the above for a brief moment,  pick yourself up, brush yourself off, whisper a prayer, and start where you left off. But never, ever, ever give up.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich
title: Eena, The Tempter's Snare

quote: I was halfway across America, at the dividing line between the East of my youth and the West of my future.
author: Jack Kerouac
title: On the Road

quote: It’s not over if you’re still here,” Chronicler said. “It’s not a tragedy if you’re still alive.
author: Patrick Rothfuss
title: The Wise Man's Fear

quote: With our thoughts we make the world.
author: Buddha

quote: I know in my heart that man is good, that what is right will always eventually triumph, and there is purpose and worth to each and every life.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: If people are going to be allowed to say "we love you" and "I love you", they'd better have the backbone to prove it. Love isn't just a word.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: I'm often asked what I think about as I run. Usually the people who ask this have never run long distances themselves. I always ponder the question. What exactly do I think about when I'm running? I don't have a clue.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: What I Talk About When I Talk About Running

quote: Love doesn't always come when you want it to. Sometimes it just happens, despite your will.
author: V.C. Andrews
title: Flowers in the Attic

quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you believe you can, you might. If you know you can, you will.
author: Steve Maraboli
title: Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: What is demanded of man is not, as some existential philosophers teach, to endure the meaninglessness of life, but rather to bear his incapacity to grasp its unconditional meaningfulness in rational terms.
author: Viktor E. Frankl
title: Man's Search for Meaning

quote: IN THE END… We only regret the chances we didn’t take, the relationships we were afraid to have,and the decisions we waited too long to make.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: People live their lives bound by what they accept as correct and true. That’s how they define Reality. But what does it mean to be “correct” or “true”? Merely vague concepts… Their Reality may all be a mirage. Can we consider them to simply be living in their own world, shaped by their beliefs?
author: Masashi Kishimoto

quote: It doesn’t matter what we are. It matters what we do.
author: Michelle Hodkin
title: The Evolution of Mara Dyer

quote: You don’t get to pick where you’re from, but you always have control of where you’re going.
author: Chris Colfer
title: Struck By Lightning: The Carson Phillips Journal

quote: Somewhere along the way we all go a bit mad. So burn, let go and dive into the horror, because maybe it’s the chaos which helps us find where we belong.
author: robert m drake

quote: Always tell what you feel. Do what you think...
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: Wrong will be right, when Aslan comes in sight, At the sound of his roar, sorrows will be no more, When he bares his teeth, winter meets its death, And when he shakes his mane, we shall have spring again.
author: C.S. Lewis
title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

quote: Why do I have to tell a story?” I asked. “Because if you don’t tell the story, someone else will tell it for you.
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
title: The Inheritance Games

quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
author: Helen Keller
title: The Open Door

quote: When I get sad, I stop being sad and be awesome instead.
author: Barney Stinson

quote: A child may not know how to feed itself, or what to eat, yet it knows hunger.
author: Daniel Keyes
title: Flowers for Algernon

quote: Success is the ability to go from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I keep thinking about a tale my nurse used to read to me about a bird whose wings are pinned to the ground. In the end, when he finally frees himself, he flies so high he becomes a star. My nurse said the story was about how we all have something that keeps us down.
author: Shannon Hale
title: Princess Academy

quote: Kecantikan yang abadi terletak pada keelokan adab dan ketinggian ilmu seseorang. Bukan terletak pada wajah dan pakaiannya.
author: Hamka

quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Champions have the courage to keep turning the pages because they know a better chapter lies ahead.
author: Paula White

quote: Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it.
author: Maimonides
title: The Guide for the Perplexed

quote: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.
author: Michael J. Fox

quote: you don't have to worry about burning bridges, if you're building your own
author: Kerry E. Wagner

quote: It is harder to crack prejudice than an atom.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Life is and will ever remain an equation incapable of solution, but it contains certain known factors.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?
author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Letters to Various Persons

quote: You make the world a better place by making daily improvements to become the best version of yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: And so I wait. I wait for time to heal the pain and raise me to me feet once again - so that I can start a new path, my own path, the one that will make me whole again.
author: Jack Canfield
title: Chicken Soup for the Teenage Soul II

quote: If people reach perfection they vanish, you know.
author: T.H. White
title: The Once and Future King

quote: You could do a lot worse.
author: Suzanne Collins
title: Catching Fire

quote: To touch the soul of another human being is to walk on holy ground.
author: Stephen Covey

quote: An education is not so much about making a living as making a person.
author: Tara Westover
title: Educated

quote: Never stop. Never stop fighting. Never stop dreaming.
author: Tom Hiddleston

quote: Maybe some things aren't meant to be known. maybe there just meant to be accepted.
author: Wendy Mass
title: Jeremy Fink and the Meaning of Life

quote: Travel is never a matter of money but of courage
author: Paulo Coelho
title: Aleph

quote: Good works is giving to the poor and the helpless, but divine works is showing them their worth to the One who matters.
author: Criss Jami
title: Killosophy

quote: A bird is safe in its nest - but that is not what its wings are made for.
author: Amit Ray
title: World Peace: The Voice of a Mountain Bird

quote: Go for it, while you can. I know you have it in you. And I can't promise you'll get everything you want, but I can promise nothing will change if you don't try.
author: J.M. Darhower
title: Sempre

quote: To those who will see, the world waits.
author: Libba Bray

quote: To progress in life, I don’t focus on how much I have done but on how much I have yet to do.
author: Idowu Koyenikan
title: Wealth for all Africans: How Every African Can Live the Life of Their Dreams

quote: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress. When you're pissed off at someone and you're angry at them, you just haven't given them enough time. Just give them a little more time and they almost always will impress you.
author: Randy Pausch

quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James
title: The Will to Believe : and Other Essays in Popular Philosophy

quote: Til shade is gone,  til water is gone Into the shadow with teeth bared Screaming defiance with the last breath To spit in Sightblinder’s eye on the Last Day.
author: Robert Jordan
title: The Dragon Reborn

quote: Sometimes to self-discover you must self-destruct.
author: robert m drake

quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: When people see some things as beautiful, other things become ugly. When people see some things as good, other things become bad.
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

quote: What helps you persevere is your resilience and commitment.
author: Roy T. Bennett
title: The Light in the Heart

quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
author: Seneca

quote: Plants are more courageous than almost all human beings: an orange tree would rather die than produce lemons, whereas instead of dying the average person would rather be someone they are not.
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quote: Nothing happens while you live. The scenery changes, people come in and go out, that's all. There are no beginnings. Days are tacked on to days without rhyme or reason, an interminable, monotonous addition.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: Nausea

quote: Who we are in the present includes who we were in the past.
author: Fred Rogers
title: Life's Journeys According to Mister Rogers: Things to Remember Along the Way

quote: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: The consequences of every act are included in the act itself.
author: George Orwell

quote: You can't dwell on what might have been...and it's not fair to condemn him for something he hasn't done.
author: Wendelin Van Draanen
title: Flipped

quote: It's very dramatic when two people come together to work something out. It's easy to take a gun and annihilate your opposition, but what is really exciting to me is to see people with differing views come together and finally respect each other.
author: Fred Rogers
title: The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember

quote: A gentleman is someone who does not what he wants to do, but what he should do.
author: Haruki Murakami
title: Norwegian Wood

quote: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
author: Richard Bach

quote: I am not worried, Harry," said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. "I am with you.
author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quote: Someday is now.
author: Gaddy Bergmann

quote: Forgive yourself before you die. Then forgive others.
author: Mitch Albom
title: Tuesdays with Morrie

quote: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Come friends, it's not too late to seek a newer world.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: What if the kid you bullied at school, grew up, and turned out to be the only surgeon who could save your life?
author: Lynette Mather

quote: You are never alone. You are eternally connected with everyone.
author: Amit Ray
title: Meditation: Insights and Inspirations

quote: Everything that is done in this world is done by hope.
author: Martin Luther

quote: You think of yourself as a citizen of the universe. You think you belong  to this world of dust and matter. Out of this dust you have created a personal image, and have forgotten about the essence of your true origin
author: Rumi
title: Hush, Don't Say Anything to God: Passionate Poems of Rumi

quote: Of all the wonders that I have heard, It seems to me most strange that men should fear; Seeing death, a necessary end, Will come when it will come. (Act II, Scene 2)
author: William Shakespeare
title: Julius Caesar

quote: One must always be prepared for riotous and endless waves of transformation.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
title: Eat, Pray, Love

quote: All human beings should try to learn before they die what they are running from, and to, and why.
author: James Thurber
